description: As a user, I want to type a command like 'Give me the radio traffic for ...' in the chat input so that I can request radio traffic playback
steps: Navigate to the chat interface
Type 'Give me the radio traffic for incident 123' in the chat input
Press enter or click send
Verify that the system recognizes the request as a radio traffic command

description: As a user, I want the system to detect UI elements with type 'radio' in LLM responses so that the appropriate playback component is rendered
steps: Send a radio traffic request through the chat
Wait for the LLM response
Verify that the response containing a UI element with type 'radio' is correctly identified
Verify that the audio URL, transcription segments, and metadata are extracted from the payload

description: As a user, I want malformed UI element data to be handled gracefully so that the application does not crash
steps: Trigger an LLM response with incomplete or malformed radio UI element data
Verify that the system logs an appropriate error
Verify that the chat interface remains functional
Verify that an appropriate error message or fallback is displayed

description: As a user, I want the system to fetch radio traffic data from the backend API so that I can listen to recordings
steps: Send a valid radio traffic request
Verify that an API call is made to the backend
Verify that a loading state is displayed while fetching
Verify that the response data is correctly received and processed

description: As a user, I want API errors to be handled properly so that I understand when something goes wrong
steps: Send a radio traffic request that will result in an API error
Verify that the error is caught and handled
Verify that an appropriate error message is displayed in the chat

description: As a user, I want to see an audio player with play/pause controls so that I can control playback
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Verify that an audio player is displayed in the response
Verify that a play button is visible
Click the play button and verify it changes to a pause button
Click the pause button and verify playback stops

description: As a user, I want to see a seek bar on the audio player so that I can navigate through the recording
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Verify that a seek bar is displayed showing progress
Click on a position in the seek bar
Verify that playback jumps to the clicked position

description: As a user, I want to see current time and total duration on the audio player so that I know the recording length
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Verify that the current time is displayed (starting at 0:00)
Verify that the total duration is displayed
Play the audio and verify the current time updates

description: As a user, I want the audio player to be keyboard accessible so that I can control it without a mouse
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Tab to the audio player controls
Press Enter or Space to play/pause
Verify that keyboard controls work correctly
Verify that ARIA labels are present on controls

description: As a user, I want to see transcription segments with speaker callsigns so that I know who is speaking
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Verify that a transcription section is displayed
Verify that each segment has a speaker callsign label
Verify that callsigns are visually distinct from the transcription text

description: As a user, I want to see 'Unknown' displayed when a speaker cannot be identified so that I understand the limitation
steps: Request radio traffic that contains unidentified speakers
Verify that segments with unidentified speakers show 'Unknown' as the callsign
Verify that the 'Unknown' label is styled consistently with other callsigns

description: As a user, I want different speakers to be visually distinguished so that I can easily follow the conversation
steps: Request radio traffic with multiple speakers
Verify that different speakers have distinct visual styling (color coding or similar)
Verify that the same speaker has consistent styling throughout the transcription

description: As a user, I want the current word to be highlighted during playback so that I can follow along
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Start audio playback
Verify that the current word or phrase is highlighted
Verify that the highlight moves smoothly as playback progresses

description: As a user, I want the highlight to update when I seek to a different position so that synchronization is maintained
steps: Request radio traffic and start playback
Seek to a different position using the seek bar
Verify that the transcription highlight immediately jumps to the correct word/phrase
Verify that playback and highlight remain synchronized

description: As a user, I want the transcription to auto-scroll during playback so that highlighted text stays visible
steps: Request radio traffic with a long transcription
Start audio playback
Verify that the transcription container scrolls automatically
Verify that the highlighted text remains visible in the viewport

description: As a user, I want auto-scroll to pause when I manually scroll so that I can read at my own pace
steps: Request radio traffic and start playback
Manually scroll the transcription container
Verify that auto-scroll pauses and does not fight user scrolling
Verify that auto-scroll resumes when appropriate (e.g., after user stops scrolling)

description: As a user, I want the radio traffic response to show a loading state while fetching so that I know the system is working
steps: Send a radio traffic request
Verify that a loading skeleton or indicator is displayed
Wait for the data to load
Verify that the loading state is replaced with the actual content

description: As a user, I want to see an error state when radio traffic cannot be loaded so that I understand what happened
steps: Send a radio traffic request that will fail
Verify that an error message is displayed in the chat
Verify that the error message is descriptive and helpful

description: As a user, I want the radio traffic component to be responsive so that it works on different screen sizes
steps: Request radio traffic on a desktop viewport
Verify that the layout displays correctly
Resize the browser to a mobile viewport
Verify that the layout adapts appropriately for the smaller screen

description: As a user, I want to request multiple radio traffic recordings in the same chat session so that I can compare them
steps: Send a radio traffic request and wait for the response
Send a second radio traffic request for different content
Verify that both responses are displayed in the chat
Verify that each response has independent playback controls

description: As a user, I want the transcription to have proper semantic HTML so that screen readers can interpret it correctly
steps: Request radio traffic and wait for the response
Inspect the transcription HTML structure
Verify that appropriate semantic elements are used
Verify that speaker labels are correctly associated with their segments
